ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would strongly recommend it, though Im not sure if all the topics one expects form a first sequence con comparative politics are covered.
I would summarize it as an overview of the various research methods in the field - some more successful than others, and a great overview of the differences between journal articles and books.
Very good introduction to issues of research design in comparative politics, and a good introduction to the business of academic political science in general.
I give it my highest recommendation - a "must" for students of politics.
Yes. It is an excellent grounding in how comparative politics is done and how it should be done.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class was extraordinarily helpful in understanding the strengths and weaknesses of particular research designs, especially in thinking through the structure of an argument. Also very helpful in learning more about the politics of journal publications.
Contributed to knowledge and my research by introducing me to some of the most important things to keep in mind when trying to do good research.
It made a very great contribution to my ability to identify interesting questions and think through how to go about conducting research using appropriate designs.
